Articles.Content:
My cannon rounds are each made up of six scatter gun pellets, so they have a lot of parts.

From TinyUpload's upload page:

"Four simple TinyUpload.com's rules:

-no download, upload limits

-50 MB per file

-downloaded files hosted for ever

-100% free"

The broadside cannons are working fine, and they're absolutely devastating.

Edited May 4, 2014 by Megalodon 720
Rules 2.4: "Files are stored on TinyUpload.com's server forever, unless they are not downloaded for 100 days." damned terms of agreement

Right now I'm going to take a break to spend time with family, ps3 and fishing

I ll keep posting to chat but next big post I ll make will be an overhaul of my ships
How did the exams go?

Rules 2.4: "Files are stored on TinyUpload.com's server forever, unless they are not downloaded for 100 days." damned terms of agreement

What crafts are you looking for?

What crafts are you looking for?

Well, actually, most of them. But to be more specific:

Nautilus, Dakuwaga, Suijin and of course Pandora

Okay, so i finished a little craft i started earlier (still in the prototype phase) which was designed as a search-and-rescue craft.

Anyway, here it is with Victory, my flagship, and i can't help but feel inspired by this screenshot.

Well, actually, most of them. But to be more specific:

Nautilus, Dakuwaga, Suijin and of course Pandora

Okay those download links are updated.

"Hans, ready Ze cannon!"

<accidentally jettisons tanks and extends panels instead>

"NO HANS VAT ARE YOU DOINGZ DOWN THERE?"

"Hans, ready Ze cannon!"

<accidentally jettisons tanks and extends panels instead>

"NO HANS VAT ARE YOU DOINGZ DOWN THERE?"

In my fleet, that stuff normally goes much more like this:

Edited May 4, 2014 by ScriptKitt3h

Well, all this talk of surface/air combat got me in the mood to make a tank:

The landing legs are necessary due to the immense recoil, which caused some earlier... test subjects... to get crushed as the tank flipped halfway over.
I may be wrong but... isn't it safer to ride inside the tank?

I may be wrong but... isn't it safer to ride inside the tank?

They're just grunts, plus the tank's automated. (They also pissed me off by phasing through the runway, getting stuck, and crashing the game)

Plus, this meets whatever safety standards KSC has! (Which is none )

So, daemon, you wanna do a surface battle? If so, may I pick locale and rules?

(I've got time to kill, and have no idea if MinusUdn is coming back to continue with me.)
Am I the only one who noticed that me and Daemon are the only ones with a Navy?

Am I the only one who noticed that me and Daemon are the only ones with a Navy?

http://i.imgur.com/tIew73Q.png

http://i.imgur.com/on8dk4o.png

I've considered making a navy, but I have no idea whatsoever about how to make military boats. Plus, I've only ever made one barely functional boat, which was an unrealistic catamaran.

BTW, those ships look awesome.

Am I the only one who noticed that me and Daemon are the only ones with a Navy?

No you're not.

How I wish this wasn't the only screenshot I have.

EDIT:More SSTOery!

Now with RCS

Edited May 5, 2014 by Spartwo

Zekes also has a navy...

@ScriptKitt3h- Sure. Set up the rules. Remember land units tend to be lighter than space ships, but boats are about the same mass. Also, you should place a flag somewhere and limit the area of the battle to be within a certain distance from that flag so it doesn't get too spread out.

Edited May 5, 2014 by daemonCaptrix
Maybe i could try making a navy, i've got quite a good idea.
Spartwo I mean with more than one naval ship. Zekes has a navy?

Spartwo I mean with more than one naval ship. Zekes has a navy?

He did a naval battle with me before.

Oh, I remember that now, That old naval fleet was retired ages ago from what Zekes said. I'd like to make a promise that I will not lurk this time and actually battle in this thread, The Arcadian Space Command is officially being formed soon.
My first ever ocean capable ship, still can't think of a name though.

@ScriptKitt3h- Sure. Set up the rules. Remember land units tend to be lighter than space ships, but boats are about the same mass. Also, you should place a flag somewhere and limit the area of the battle to be within a certain distance from that flag so it doesn't get too spread out.

Ok, cool. I've got classes today, but I'll have the first post up tonight.
